name: Sattu Paratha
description: A nutritious and flavorful stuffed paratha from Bihar made with roasted gram flour (sattu), spices, and herbs, enclosed in a whole wheat dough and shallow fried on a tawa. Commonly served with curd, pickle, and onions.
preCookingProcess: Mix whole wheat flour with a pinch of salt in a bowl.
Add enough water gradually to knead a soft yet firm dough.
Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 10â€“15 minutes.

Prepare the stuffing: In a mixing bowl, combine sattu, chopped onions, garlic, green chili, ajwain, black salt, amchur powder, salt, lemon juice, and 1 tbsp mustard oil.
Mix well using clean hands until the mixture is evenly moist but not sticky. Add a spoon of water only if too dry.
Stuff and roll the paratha: Divide the dough into equal lemon-sized portions.
Roll one ball into a small disc, place 2 tbsp of sattu mixture in the center, and seal the edges properly.
Flatten gently and roll again into a medium-sized paratha dusting with flour.
Cook the paratha: Heat a tawa on medium flame and place the rolled paratha on it.
Cook on one side until bubbles appear, flip and apply ghee or oil, then cook the other side until golden brown spots form.

postCookingProcess: Serve hot Sattu Paratha with curd, pickle, and sliced onions.
Optional: add a dollop of ghee for authentic Bihari flavor.
Best enjoyed fresh during breakfast or lunch.
tipsAndTricks: Do not make the stuffing too wet as it can break the paratha.
Use mustard oil for authentic taste.
Knead the dough slightly firm for better rolling and texture.
